ovdesc.p: Stores the publicly known Standing Settlement Instructions for correspondent banks. They are also known as currency correspondents.
This is defined for a look-up on BIC’s and not on NCC’s. If the look-up is on a NCC then it is first converted into a BIC and then searched for in this table

desc.p: User ID of the record creator
Standard T24 alphanumeric field.
If this field is ‘N’ then it implies that the data entry will never be updated by
the upload process. If set to ‘Y’ then the data can be overridden by the upload
process.
BIC of the party for which SSI is defined
It should be a BIC-8 or a BIC-11
Record Activation Code generated for the record by the payment's hub.
Possible values:
N - Not active
A - Active
H - History
F - Future
C - Not active future
Routing product can be used to set more than one currency correspondent for a
bank.
Note - The routing product for any payment is set by the Product determination
process
Record Status Code generated for the record by the payments hub.
Possible values:
L - Live
U - Unapproved
R - Reversed
System generated unique ID
Specifies the date on which the record is to be considered active by the payments hub.
Currency for which the correspondent is defined
Date and Time when the record was approved in DD MON 2015 HH:MM:SS.MMM format
User ID of the record approver
Institution trading name.
City name of the institution/branch.
Indicates the company ID for which the record is created.
The value links to the field ‘CompanyID’ in PPT.COMPANY
Will hold BIC’s or NCC’s; the length is extended to 20 to accommodate a LEI
code.
The Currency correspondent ID for the given combination of Party BIC, Currency
and Routing Group.
The Currency correspondent ID can be a BIC in which case it can be specified as
a BIC-8 or a BIC-11 only. A Currency correspondent can therefore be defined for
example as - BARCGB21 or BARCGB2106P.
The Currency correspondent ID can be a National Clearing Code. A Currency
correspondent can therefore be defined for example as - SC200050
The Currency Correspondent ID type of the currency correspondent.
The Currency correspondent ID can be a BIC in which case it can be specified
as a BIC-8 or a BIC-11 only. The Currency correspondent ID type for a BIC is B.
The Currency correspondent ID can be a National Clearing Code. The Currency
correspondent ID type for a national clearing is N
Specifies the date on which the record is to be considered inactive by the payments hub.
Date and Time when the record was created in DD MON 2015 HH:MM:SS.MMM format
